oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Climate relevance of foodstuffs – what can the organic farmer do?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lindenthal, Thomas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Over the past year the Research Institute for Organic Agriculture (FiBL) Austria has been carrying out a comprehensive study regarding the climate relevance of foodstuffs (client: “Zurück zum Ursprung”/Hofer KG and the Ministry of Agriculture). This study calculated the CO2-Emissions along the entire supply chain of 95-100 organic foodstuffs as compared to conventional foodstuffs, from the agricultural production to the supermarket branches.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Lindenthal, Thomas (2009) Climate relevance of foodstuffs – what can the organic farmer do? Working paper, Research Institute for Organic Agriculture (FiBL), Austria, Vienna. [Completed]
